item.title: Fake News Discovery - Machine Learning & Data Analysis
item.description:
üì∞ This project explores misinformation detection in social media using machine learning and data visualization.

üõ† Tools Used

  • Programming: Python, Jupyter Notebook
  • Machine Learning: NLP, Scikit-learn
  • Data Processing: Pandas, NumPy, Excel
  • Data Visualization: Tableau

üß† Machine Learning Workflow

graph LR A[Raw Social Media Data] --> B[Text Preprocessing] B --> C[NLP Techniques] C --> D[Feature Extraction] D --> E[Train/Test Split] E --> F[Model Training] F --> G[Evaluation] G --> H[Prediction]

item.title: The Open University - Student Dropout & Performance Analysis
item.description:
üìä This project analyzes student demographics and performance metrics from The Open University in the UK, focusing on the October 2014 cohort of 10,670 learners. Using Tableau, I explored patterns across gender, age group, region, and prior education to uncover insights that could inform support strategies and curriculum planning.

  • Previous Education Impact: How qualification levels affect dropout rates.
  • Final Results by Gender: Performance differences between male and female students.
  • Age & Region Analysis: Understanding how student demographics vary across the UK.
  • Students’ Average GPA: Mapping academic performance across different locations.

üõ† Tools Used

  • Data Processing: Excel, SQL
  • Geospatial Mapping: GeoJSON, Mapshaper
  • Visualization: Tableau
  • Analytics Focus: Student Retention, Performance Metrics, GIS Mapping

üìç Geospatial Analysis
